templates.title: Risk Assessment Documentation
templates.description: Documented cybersecurity risk assessment for your organization
templates.recommendation: Conduct a formal cybersecurity risk assessment and document the findings
templates.help_text: Upload or reference your latest cybersecurity risk assessment document
templates.why_matters: Required by law to identify and document cybersecurity risks to your business operations

info.what_it_means: A formal document that identifies, analyzes, and evaluates cybersecurity risks to your organization's information systems and data.
info.why_it_matters: Required by Moldova's Cybersecurity Law to demonstrate proactive risk management and compliance with regulatory requirements.

templates.title: Cybersecurity Policy
templates.description: Formal cybersecurity policy document approved by management
templates.recommendation: Develop and approve a comprehensive cybersecurity policy
templates.help_text: A written policy covering cybersecurity roles, responsibilities, and procedures
templates.why_matters: Establishes the foundation for your cybersecurity program and compliance efforts

info.what_it_means: A comprehensive written document that outlines your organization's approach to cybersecurity, including roles, responsibilities, and procedures.
info.why_it_matters: Provides clear guidance for employees and demonstrates management commitment to cybersecurity compliance.

templates.title: MFA for Privileged Accounts
templates.description: Multi-factor authentication enabled for administrator and privileged user accounts
templates.recommendation: Enable MFA for all administrator and privileged accounts immediately
templates.help_text: All admin accounts should require at least two authentication factors
templates.why_matters: Prevents unauthorized access even if passwords are compromised

info.what_it_means: Multi-factor authentication requires users to provide two or more verification factors to access privileged accounts.
info.why_it_matters: Significantly reduces the risk of unauthorized access even if passwords are compromised or stolen.

templates.title: Regular Access Reviews
templates.description: Periodic review of user access rights and permissions
templates.recommendation: Establish a quarterly access review process
templates.help_text: Review who has access to what systems at least annually
templates.why_matters: Ensures employees only have access to systems they need for their current role

info.what_it_means: Regular review and validation of user access rights to ensure employees only have access to systems necessary for their current role.
info.why_it_matters: Prevents privilege creep and reduces security risks by ensuring access rights remain appropriate over time.

templates.title: Centralized Security Logging
templates.description: Security events are logged in a centralized system
templates.recommendation: Implement centralized logging for all critical systems
templates.help_text: All security-relevant events should be collected in one place
templates.why_matters: Enables detection of security incidents and forensic investigation

info.what_it_means: Centralized collection and storage of security events from all systems in a single, searchable location.
info.why_it_matters: Essential for detecting security incidents, conducting forensic investigations, and meeting compliance requirements.

templates.title: Log Retention (≥12 months)
templates.description: Security logs are retained for at least 12 months
templates.recommendation: Configure log retention for at least 12 months
templates.help_text: Legal requirement to maintain logs for investigation purposes
templates.why_matters: Required by law for incident investigation and compliance audits

info.what_it_means: A documented policy that defines how long security logs must be retained, typically 12 months minimum.
info.why_it_matters: Required by law to support incident investigation and compliance audits. Insufficient retention can result in penalties.

templates.title: Backup Strategy Documented
templates.description: Formal backup and recovery procedures are documented
templates.recommendation: Document your backup strategy and test it regularly
templates.help_text: Written procedures for backing up and restoring critical data
templates.why_matters: Ensures business continuity in case of data loss or ransomware attacks

info.what_it_means: A comprehensive written plan that outlines how critical data is backed up, stored, and can be restored.
info.why_it_matters: Essential for business continuity and recovery from data loss, ransomware attacks, or system failures.

templates.title: Last Successful Restore Test
templates.description: Recent test of backup restoration procedures
templates.recommendation: Test backup restoration procedures at least quarterly
templates.help_text: When did you last verify that backups can be successfully restored?
templates.why_matters: Backups are only useful if they can be successfully restored when needed

info.what_it_means: Regular testing to verify that backup data can be successfully restored and systems can be recovered.
info.why_it_matters: Backups are worthless if they cannot be restored. Regular testing ensures recovery procedures work when needed.

templates.title: SPF/DKIM/DMARC Implementation
templates.description: Email authentication protocols are properly configured
templates.recommendation: Configure SPF, DKIM, and DMARC records for your email domain
templates.help_text: These protocols help prevent email spoofing and phishing attacks
templates.why_matters: Protects your domain from being used in phishing attacks and improves email deliverability

info.what_it_means: Email authentication protocols that verify the legitimacy of emails sent from your domain.
info.why_it_matters: Prevents email spoofing and phishing attacks, improving email security and deliverability.

templates.title: Security Audit (≤3 years)
templates.description: External security audit within the last 3 years
templates.recommendation: Schedule an external security audit
templates.help_text: Independent assessment of your cybersecurity controls
templates.why_matters: Provides objective validation of your security measures

info.what_it_means: An independent, third-party assessment of your organization's cybersecurity controls and practices.
info.why_it_matters: Provides objective validation of security measures and helps identify gaps that internal teams might miss.

templates.title: ISO 27001 Certification
templates.description: ISO 27001 information security management certification
templates.recommendation: Consider pursuing ISO 27001 certification
templates.help_text: International standard for information security management
templates.why_matters: Demonstrates commitment to information security best practices

info.what_it_means: XXXXXAn international standard that specifies requirements for establishing, implementing, and maintaining an information security management system.
info.why_it_matters: Demonstrates commitment to information security best practices and can provide competitive advantage.

templates.title: Last Security Awareness Training
templates.description: Date of most recent cybersecurity training for employees
templates.recommendation: Provide annual cybersecurity awareness training for all employees
templates.help_text: All employees should receive cybersecurity awareness training
templates.why_matters: Employees are the first line of defense against cyber attacks

info.what_it_means: Regular training programs that educate employees about cybersecurity threats, best practices, and their role in protecting organizational data.
info.why_it_matters: Employees are often the first line of defense against cyber attacks. Well-trained staff significantly reduce security risks.

templates.title: SSL Certificate Validation
templates.description: SSL certificates are valid and properly configured
templates.recommendation: Ensure all HTTPS services have valid SSL certificates
templates.help_text: Certificate should be valid, not expired, and properly configured
templates.why_matters: Ensures encrypted communication and builds user trust

info.what_it_means: Valid SSL/TLS certificate that enables encrypted communication between users and your website.
info.why_it_matters: Ensures encrypted communication, builds user trust, and prevents data interception.

templates.title: HTTP Security Headers
templates.description: Security headers like HSTS are properly configured
templates.recommendation: Configure security headers including HSTS, CSP, and X-Frame-Options
templates.help_text: Headers like HSTS, CSP, and X-Frame-Options protect against common attacks
templates.why_matters: Prevents common web vulnerabilities and attacks

info.what_it_means: HTTP security headers that provide additional protection against common web vulnerabilities and attacks.
info.why_it_matters: Prevents common web attacks like clickjacking, XSS, and protocol downgrade attacks.

templates.title: Open Ports Security Review
templates.description: All open ports have been reviewed and justified
templates.recommendation: Regularly review all open ports and services
templates.help_text: Only required ports should be accessible from the internet
templates.why_matters: Reduces attack surface and potential entry points

info.what_it_means: Identification of unnecessary open network ports that could be exploited by attackers.
info.why_it_matters: Reduces attack surface by closing unnecessary entry points to your systems.

templates.title: Service Authentication
templates.description: Services require proper authentication and authorization
templates.recommendation: Ensure all exposed services implement proper authentication mechanisms
templates.help_text: Database and admin services should never be directly accessible from the internet
templates.why_matters: Prevents unauthorized access to sensitive services and data

info.what_it_means: Proper authentication and authorization controls for all exposed network services.
info.why_it_matters: Prevents unauthorized access to sensitive services and data, especially critical for database and admin services.

templates.title: Web Service Security
templates.description: Web services are properly secured and configured
templates.recommendation: Web services should use HTTPS, implement proper authentication, and include security headers
templates.help_text: This is automatically checked by our scanning tools
templates.why_matters: Encrypts data in transit and builds user trust

info.what_it_means: Comprehensive security configuration for web services including encryption, authentication, and protective headers.
info.why_it_matters: Protects web applications from common attacks and ensures data is encrypted in transit.

templates.title: HTTP to HTTPS Redirect
templates.description: HTTP traffic is properly redirected to HTTPS
templates.recommendation: Configure automatic redirection from HTTP to HTTPS
templates.help_text: All web traffic should be automatically upgraded to secure connections
templates.why_matters: Ensures all web traffic is encrypted and secure

info.what_it_means: Automatic redirection that forces all HTTP traffic to use HTTPS encryption.
info.why_it_matters: Ensures all web traffic is encrypted and prevents accidental transmission of sensitive data over unencrypted connections.

templates.title: Insecure Service Detection
templates.description: No insecure services (FTP, Telnet, unencrypted protocols) are exposed
templates.recommendation: Replace insecure protocols with secure alternatives
templates.help_text: Protocols like FTP, Telnet, and unencrypted HTTP should not be exposed
templates.why_matters: Insecure protocols can be easily intercepted and exploited

info.what_it_means: Detection of insecure network protocols that transmit data in plaintext or have known security vulnerabilities.
info.why_it_matters: Insecure protocols can be easily intercepted, allowing attackers to steal credentials and sensitive data.

templates.title: Development Environment Exposure
templates.description: Development and staging environments are not publicly accessible
templates.recommendation: Ensure development environments are not accessible from the public internet
templates.help_text: Development environments often contain sensitive information and should be protected
templates.why_matters: Prevents information disclosure and reduces attack surface

info.what_it_means: Detection of development, staging, and test environments that are inadvertently exposed to the public internet.
info.why_it_matters: Development environments often contain sensitive information, debug data, and may have weaker security controls.

templates.title: High-Risk Port Exposure
templates.description: High-risk ports (RDP, SMB, database) are not exposed to the internet
templates.recommendation: High-risk services should never be directly accessible from the internet
templates.help_text: Services like RDP, SMB, and databases should be protected behind VPN or firewall
templates.why_matters: High-risk services are frequently targeted by attackers

info.what_it_means: Detection of high-risk network services that are commonly targeted by attackers and should not be directly accessible from the internet.
info.why_it_matters: Services like RDP, SMB, and database ports are frequently targeted in automated attacks and should be protected by VPN or other secure access methods.
